column1: A river of molten metal, slowly oozing downhill.
An everburning pillar of fire, a dozen feet tall.
A large plain covered in a knee-deep layer of ash.
A volcanic eruption, far in the distance but still dramatic and awe-inspiring.
A steaming rock surface, its surface recently congealed into strange, smooth shapes.
A deep chasm, the glow of molten lava far below.
An artificial structure resembling a chimney. Black smoke emerges from the top.
A valley carved by the passage of molten lava, which left behind gigantic diamond-like pillars.
A clearly artificial channel dug in the hard stone surface, somehow still flowing with cold running water, which quickly plunges off a mountainside.
